intro: Sebastiania chamaelea var. asperococca, commonly known as the rough-seeded sebastiania, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and distinctive, rough-textured fruits. The leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a glossy surface. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting structures. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
